title: [Large-scale] Online Collaborative Science Inquiry Project: Mobile Microlearning-based Cooperative Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of fundamental scientific theories and experimental methods
context.additional_context: Real-time collaborative learning using mobile devices (smartphones/tablets) in a BYOD environment

learning_goals: Learners can share scientific problem-solving ideas at least three times using mobile collaboration tools (e.g., Google Jamboard, Padlet).
Learners can critique peers' scientific arguments at least five times according to rubric-based peer evaluation criteria in online discussion forums.
Learners can collaboratively write one scientific report (approximately 500 characters) per team by analyzing virtual lab data (e.g., PhET simulations).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
